pros: Challenging and fulfilling work. I enjoyed it.
cons: Pay for local staff was not great

pros: stable workplace with predictable work amount
Good salary, nice, friendly atmosphere, genuine willingness to help each other, true collegiality. Ergonomically correct working stations.
cons: Extremely heavy workload, it exceeds what should be expected from the employer.

review_title: Good Salary, less opportunities for local staff
cons: There tends to be some kind of discrimination against local G Staff.

job_title: Learning and Talent Development Officer in Budapest
pros: being part of the United Nations family and helping people of concern.
cons: Contracts are often Temporary only (6 months or less).

network matters when it comes to the recruitment to the international positions, not competencies; poor distribution of workload: a big gap between the local salaries in different locations, and within the general and national categories.

job_title: Senior Personnel Administrative Assistant in Budapest
pros: Everyone is very polite and nice
cons: Things take forever to get done

review_title: Great insight into learning how a UN institution works
pros: At the UNHCR, there are many opportunities to utilize a wide range of skills. Because I interned in the Supply Chain, I learned of the many ways items are sourced and brought over to refugee beneficiaries all over the globe. You'll improve your global networking abilities, but don't get too attached to your coworkers--chances are they're leaving for mission soon.
cons: In its essence, the UNHCR is a bureaucratic institution. Do not expect to create great changes in a fast way. These guys are quite set in their ways, and no amount of altruism can change some of these guys' minds when it comes to thinking of a new way of doing something. Also, as an intern, you don't get paid, so there's that.

pros:
Multicultural environment
Competitive salary
Prestigous workplace
Nicely furnished office
International organizational culture
Good location
Medical plan and pension fund opportunities
cons:
Global Service Center
Monotonous work
Not easy to get a job as an external candidate
Long recruitement
Only supporting UN national staff

job_title: Staff Training and Development Manager in Budapest
pros: International environment, experienced staff, and great atmosphere. Opportunities for learning (in-house language training, other professional development opportunities), traveling, networking.
cons: High level of bureaucracy which significantly slows down many activities. UNHCR is an international humanitarian agency funded by donors thus there is always some uncertainty in terms of future career plans because mostly short-term contracts are awarded.

pros: Great working environment, intellectual challenges. Decent salary
cons: Not fixed future, few career opportunities

review_title: Working for the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees
pros: Hands-on experience dealing with some of the most consequential matters in the world.
cons: The bureaucratic structure of the organization makes it difficult to do your best.
Being tossed around: Your position can be cut any time and will be cut sometime...

review_title: Heavy bureaucracy for a good cause

pros: Great cause, good pay, nice facility.

Stressful work environment.
Multiple bosses in small units.
